title: Deadlock Avoidance (Bankerâ€™s Algorithm)
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
Allow dynamic requests but check if granting them leads to Unsafe State. 
**Banker's Algorithm**: 
1. Check if (Request <= Available).
2. Pretend to allocate.
3. Check if system is still safe (Can everyone finish?).
4. If yes, grant. Else, wait.

common_mistakes.correction: No. Unsafe means Deadlock IS POSSIBLE. Safe means Deadlock is IMPOSSIBLE.

real_world_use_cases.description: Ensuring bank always has cash to satisfy users.
